s.text: A pamphlet called How to Raise Drug-Free Kids (produced by the partnership, Reader's Digest , the Department of Education, and ABC for the project) makes the project of child-rearing sound like growing seedless watermelons.
The first question Westin should have asked himself is whether it ever makes sense for a news organization like ABC to climb into bed with an advocacy organization like the partnership.
America about kids sniffing toxic household chemicals, which it claimed kills 1,000 kids a year--a statistic that drug experts say has no basis.
